intro: Schizoptera, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. Schizoptera species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
